intro: Leucas eriostoma, commonly known as the hairy leucas, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly India and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
